intro: Coccochondra laevis subsp. laevis, commonly known as the smooth coccochondra, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Arecaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and a distinctive, elongated stem structure. This subspecies is typically found in specific tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Its botanical features include a unique leaf morphology and a limited geographic distribution. Due to its rarity, it is often of interest to botanists and conservationists.
